main event: A bright light, described as a flying saucer, was reported over the Atomic Energy Commission's plant in Aiken, South Carolina, on December 9, 1950.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes and was witnessed by multiple people., The object was described as 50 to 60 feet in diameter., Reverend R. D. Perkinson compared the object to a big white star with beams and spokes., The object was seen hovering before it shot away at a high speed., This report was formally documented in the Project Blue Book program of the U.S. Air Force.
sighted object: a bright light resembling a flying saucer
witness description: Reverend R. D. Perkinson, A. H. Iradell McCarthy, and his daughter Evelyn
